revised_title: In-depth Study of Excised Mammalian Heart's Action and Electrical Properties
tldr: This study investigates the action and electrical properties of excised mammalian hearts, focusing on spontaneous and excited contractions, the role of temperature, and the direction of electrical currents. The research reveals that excised hearts can have longer contractions and latent periods, and that electrical variations can be detected even after visible contractions have ceased.
